title: How to write good statement of purpose - Quora

response.answer_text: The Statement of Purpose is the single most important part of your application that will tell the admissions committee who you are, what has influenced your career path so far, your professional interests and where you plan to go from here. Following points should be covered in a SOP - Experience in the field –This should reflect your passion in the field. Write everything that you have worked for in this field including your project, internships, industry work experience, workshops, seminars, classes and any other activitiesAcademic performance –Any academic accomplishments must be mentioned.Project and work related challenges - Instead of specifying a lot of technicalities about the project, mention the hardships and challenges you faced and how you overcame them.Concluding Paragraph - The concluding paragraph must convey your purpose in pursuing MS or other degree from that particular University.Others - You can also add Extra-curricular activities if you still feel you can accommodate it in the given word limit. Although, it is advisable not to mention activities other than your field, unless you have won any major accolades for the same.Essential Tips - Most of the universities specify the length of SOP ranging from 500-1000 words this is about two A4 size pages. Make sure you do not exceed the maximum length specified.There is no rule for font but it should be easily readable and black in color. Times New Roman(font size 12) or Arial(font size 11) are most commonly used in US.What the admissions committee will read between the lines: self-motivation, competence, potential as a graduate student.Emphasize everything from a positive perspective and write in an active, not a passive voice.Demonstrate everything by example; don’t say directly that you’re a persistent person, show it.If there is something important that happened to you that affected your grades, such as poverty, illness, or excessive work, state it. Write it affirmatively, showing your perseverance despite obstacles. You can elaborate more in your personal statement.Make sure everything is linked with continuity and focus.

Applying to graduate school is a complex and time-consuming process that requires lots of responsibility, effort and a whole set of different documents to let you get accepted to the desired institution. Letters of recommendation, resumes/CVs, test scores, cover letters, essays, etc. are essential for a good application but writing a Successful Statement of Purpose is of the greatest importance, indeed.  This paper can sufficiently increase your admission chances, especially if it’s properly written. By presenting a powerful SoP, you’ll be able to convince your readers (in this case, the admission committee of the university you’re applying to) that you have a solid background (valuable experience in the chosen program, prominent achievements, useful skills and personal qualities necessary to succeed in the sphere you’re aiming at) which will help you to stand out from the crowd of other candidates and show that you have a potential to become a great specialist. When you start writing your statement of purpose, don’t forget to divide it into four parts and include the following points: Start by introducing yourself. Tell about your interests and things that motivated you to choose a particular program and institution, let the admission committee understand what sparked your desire to apply for graduate school.Sum up your previous academic career (meaning your undergraduate study): mention any research you’ve conducted, important thesis papers or projects and your work experience (if it’s related to the program you’re applying to).Tell about your past or recent activities: tell what you’ve learned and how it helped you to concentrate on getting into graduate school (but make sure that these activities are relevant to the speciality you’ve picked).Describe your academic interests as well. In this part of your SoP you have to indicate what you’d like to study at the university you’re about to get in order to assure the admission committee that you’re aware of the research scope in the desired discipline. When you’re done with formulating all of the points mentioned in the list above, remember a few more things: since the admission committee read between the lines, make sure you let them understand how competent and self-motivated you are as a future graduate student; describe everything positively; always provide concrete examples, do not simply tell; be concise and manage your time right. Hope these tips will help you to reach your goal and get admitted into the university of your dream, good luck!
